question: The length of no two sides of a triangle is equal. Identify the type of triangle.
Which of the following triangles can never exist?
options: A triangle with all angles acute
A triangle with all angles obtuse
A triangle with one angle obtuse and two angles acute
A triangle with one angle right and two angles acute

question: Which triangle has at least two equal sides?
If each angle of a triangle measures 60°, what type of triangle is it?

Comment on the following statement.
Isosceles triangles are always acute triangles.
A triangle has two angles measuring 50° and 60°. What type of triangle is it?
Which of the following statements is incorrect?
options: An equilateral triangle is also isosceles.
A right triangle cannot be isosceles.
A scalene triangle has no equal sides.
An obtuse triangle has one angle greater than 90°.

question: Which of the following angle measures can form an obtuse-angled triangle?
Which of the following triangles has all three sides of different lengths and one angle greater than 90°?

Samantha is cutting a triangular piece of fabric. She measures the three sides and finds they are 9 cm, 15 cm, and 12 cm. She claims it is an isosceles triangle. Is she correct? If not, what type of triangle is it?
A triangular signboard has angles measuring 75° and 35°. Raj says it is a right-angled triangle. Is he correct? If not, what type of triangle is it?
Ryan is given three angles to form a triangle: 100°, 50°, and 40°. He tries to draw the triangle but is confused. Can a triangle exist with these angles?
If the sides of the given triangle are 5 cm, 12 cm, and 13 cm, what is the value of side c?
Find the other two angles in the figure given below.
A triangle has the following properties: One of its angles is greater than 90° and no two sides are equal in length. What type of triangle is it?
